data.title: EniqEq: Compression Prosaic
data.statement:
Given a string, write a function to perform basic string compression using the counts of repeated characters.

Compression of a letter should be done only if it appears consecutively for more than [[limit]] times.
data.constraints:
[[string]] (1 <= length of [[string]] <= 10^2): a string containing uppercase and lowercase letters (a-z, A-Z).

[[limit]] (1 <= [[limit]] <= length of [[string]]): a positive integer representing the consecutive repetition limit.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Given a string, write a function to perform basic string compression using the counts of repeated characters.

Compression of a letter should be done only if it appears consecutively for more than limit times.
Input
Line 1: The string.
Line 2: An integer limit for the length of consecutive run of the same letter where compression should be performed if it has been exceeded.
Output
The function should return a string. If the count of consecutive occurrences exceeds a specified limit, replace the repeated characters with a single occurrence and append the count.
Constraints
string (1 <= length of string <= 10^2): a string containing uppercase and lowercase letters (a-z, A-Z).

limit (1 <= limit <= length of string): a positive integer representing the consecutive repetition limit.
Example
Input
xxxzzzff
2
Output
x3z3ff
